conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, we need to analyze the slopes of their respective velocity-time (v-t) graphs. The slope of a v-t graph represents acceleration.
Particle A accelerates from t = 0 to t = t_0.
Particle B accelerates from t = 0 to t = 5t_0.

premise: Initial velocity, u_A = 0 (starts from rest). Final velocity, v_A = 2v_0 at t = t_0.
Initial velocity, u_B = 0 (starts from rest). Final velocity, v_B = v_0 at t = 5t_0.
